properties.areaDesc: Southern Oconto County; Waupaca; Portage; Shawano; Menominee; Waushara
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 10:43PM CST by NWS Green Bay WI
properties.description:
Light snow or flurries will continue at times into early Thursday
morning. Total snow accumulation of 1 to 3 inches. The combination
of new snow, or melting snow on pavement surfaces Wednesday
afternoon and evening will continue to cause untreated roads,
bridges, parking lots and sidewalks to be snow or ice covered.
Gusty northerly winds may also create some areas of blowing and
drifting snow.

Temperatures around daybreak on Thursday are expected to fall
to zero to 5 above zero. The combination of the cold temperatures
and gusty northerly winds will produce wind chill readings in the
10 below to 20 below zero range late tonight into Thursday morning.
Wind chill readings this low can produce frost bite in 30 minutes.

Allow extra travel time if you will be driving tonight, as roads
will be slippery due to ice or snow cover. If venturing outdoors,
wear layers of clothing along with a hat and gloves to protect
yourself from the cold.

NWSheadline: HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS AND COLD WIND CHILLS OVERNIGHT
